alert.note: Alert for Bath; Fleming (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 2:57PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Bath and western Fleming Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 257 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cowan, or 8 miles west of Flemingsburg, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Nepton around 300 PM EDT. Elizaville around 305 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Pecks Ridge, Craintown, Flemingsburg, Tilton, Sherburne, Pebble, Poplar Plains and Oakley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
